result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny M. Spencer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber Privileges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny M. Spencer

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Certify Debt to the Wisconsin Department of Revenue/copy delivered to defendant at LCSD. 10-10-2022
JU, NEJ, NOT & NOC delivered to defendant on 10/10/22 at LCSD.
DNA Order and Acknowledgement and Proof of Submission

Court calls @ 2:39 PM/ RM 301, 22CM34 & 22CT7. Defendant Johnny M. Spencer appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail. Attorney Jessica J Prado in court via zoom for Johnny M. Spencer.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. State recites terms of agreement, Def. to plea Guilty or No Contest in 22CM34 to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2 and Ct. 3. In 22CT7, Def. to plea Guilty or No Contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read in. Ct. 1 in 22CM34, Def. to serve 4 months jail time, pay court costs, to run consecutive to any other sentence. Ct. 1 in 22CT7, Def. to serve 60 days jail time, pay court costs, to run consecutive to any other sentence. Atty Prado is in agreeance. Def. is also in agreeance. Court notes other pending cases in Langlade County, being held separately. Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with Def. Def. pleas Guilty to Ct. 1 in 22CM34. In 22CT7, Ct. 1, Def. pleas Guilty. Court grants states motion to dismiss and read in on 22CM34 Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 and also Ct. 2 in 22CT7. Court reviews Def. constitutional rights, all potential penalties and charges and all elements. Def. advised of potential deportation if not US Citizen. Atty Prado has reviewed plea questionnaire and waiver of rights with Def. and is satisfied. Court finds Def. is freely and voluntarily entering into plea agreement and has reviewed criminal complaint. Court finds adequate and factual basis and accepts Def. pleas. Court finds Def. Guilty on Ct. 1 in 22CM34 and on Ct. 1 in 22CT7. State requests Court to adopt joint recommendation and notes Def. prior record. Atty Prado makes sentencing remarks, requests Court adopt joint recommendation and requests a concurrent sentence. Def. has no remarks. Court questions Def. previous charges and prior employment. Def. responds. Court considers sentencing factors and orders on 22CM34 Ct. 1, Def. to serve 60 days jail time, Def. to pay court costs to include a $200 DNA surcharge, to run consecutive to any other sentence to date. 22CT7 Ct. 1, Def. to serve 30 days of jail time, pay court costs to include a $200 DNA surcharge, to run consecutive to 22CM34 and any other sentence received prior to today. No cash bond on either case to satisfy court costs. Court orders court costs be converted into a civil judgment. State has no recommendation. Atty Prado has no argument. Def. requests civil judgment. Court orders court costs ordered today be immediately entered into a civil judgement. State does not believe Def. should be awarded credit on either case. Atty. Prado has no recommendation. Court finds Def. is not entitled to any credit at this time. Court finds Def. eligible for Huber privileges and advises Def. of right to appeal.

Court calls 22CM34, 22CT7 & 22CF99 @ 1:39 PM Defendant Johnny M. Spencer appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jessica J Prado in court, via zoom for Johnny M. Spencer.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Prado is only on CM case.  Def. wishes to have counsel on felony case.  Court finds goods cause to go past time limits.  Atty Prado would like offer on CM case.  State would like Status on CM Case. 22CF99 7-25- @ 1:30
Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Court calls 22CM34, 22CT7 & 22CF99 @02:26 PM Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in court with attorney Jessica J Prado appears only for misdemeanor.  Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnny M. Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney. 22CF99 Def. wants counsel. AIA 6-27-22 @ 1:30.  Atty Prado would request Status.  State would request to track felony case. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls 22CT7, 22CM34 & 22CF99 @ 01:48 PM Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in court with attorney Jessica J Prado via zoom.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in court with attorney Jessica J Prado.  Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnny M. Spencer appeared by video means with Attorney, via zoom. Atty Prado only handles misdemeanor.  22CM34  Atty Prado enters Not Guilty plea. Court receives Not Guilty. Atty Prado is waiting for discovery. 22CT7 & 22CM34 will be set for Status Cnf. Def. would like to continue to wait for atty to be appointed.  22CF99 will be set for AIA on 6-6-22 @ 1:30 pm.  Atty Prado may appear for zoom on the 6th. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No driving without a valid driver's license.

01:30 PM in Room 203. Defendant Johnny M. Spencer in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Johnny M. Spencer appeared by video means. All appearances are by Zoom. 22CM34 and 22CT7. Initial on 22CM34 and 22CT7 is tracking. Def. advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants attorney, Def. directed to contact PD. State indicates this is not a victim's rights case. Recommend $500 cash bond with condition he not drive without a valid driver's license. Def. on PO hold. Def. heard on bond. The Court orders $500 cash bond with conditions. 22CT7 will track.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
